title: Burgh de Rott

properties.value: Burgh de Rott is a desolate town located in the southernmost part of Morytania. It is a focal part of the In Aid of the Myreque quest and can only be accessed after you start the quest. Places of interest include the bank, the furnace, the general store, fishing spots and the bar. Completion of Priest in Peril is required to access Morytania and Burgh de Rott.

Burgh de Rott

Burgh de Rott is a desolate town located in the southernmost part of Morytania. It is a focal part of the In Aid of the Myreque quest and can only be accessed after you start the quest. Places of interest include the bank, the furnace, the general store, fishing spots and the bar. Completion of Priest in Peril is required to access Morytania and Burgh de Rott.

Contents

  • 1 Getting there
  • 2 History
  • 3 Shops
    • 3.1 General store
  • 4 Skills
    • 4.1 Fishing
    • 4.2 Smithing
  • 5 Inhabitants
  • 6 Quests
  • 7 Minigames
  • 8 Changes
  • 9 Trivia
  • 10 Music

Getting there[edit | edit source]

  • Teleport using Morytania legs 3 or higher
  • Grouping teleport to Shades of Mort'ton (after completion of Shades of Mort'ton), or Mort'ton teleport scroll, then run south.
  • Barrows Teleport (or Barrows teleport (tablet)); running through Mort'ton and then south.
  • Fairy ring code bip (requires partial completion of Fairytale II - Cure a Queen, and 50 Agility to cross the stepping stone east into Mort Myre Swamp). Enter either west through the Low Fence requiring 25 Agility, or going through Mort'ton.
  • Boat travel from Slepe or the Icyene Graveyard after the completion of Sins of the Father.

History[edit | edit source]

Little is known about Burgh de Rott's history, but it can presumably be dated back to the time around Hallowvale in the early Third Age, as Queen Efaritay, the Queen of Hallowland's name, can still be found. Whether it was abandoned or destroyed during Lowerniel Drakan and his vampyres' invasion is unknown.

In recent times the town has become a place for human refugees, who have escaped from the vampyres' tyranny. The town is in ruins and the vampyres assume it is uninhabited and thus never go there. During In Aid of the Myreque the player helps fix up some of the essential parts of the town improving the living conditions for the residents. The fact that the town is populated was discovered by Gadderanks who accompanied by two Vampyre Juvinates came to tithe the population. The player however managed to defeat Gadderanks and the vampyres meaning that Burgh de Rott is safe for now.

Shops[edit | edit source]

General store[edit | edit source]

Main article: Aurel's Supplies

To access the general store you must repair it first using 6 planks and 24 nails. After repairing it players must stock it with 10 bronze axes, 3 tinderboxes and either 10 mackerel or 10 snails.

Skills[edit | edit source]

Fishing[edit | edit source]

All the fishing spots in Burgh de Rott are Big net/harpoon fishing spots, making this town nearly as convenient as Catherby. There also is a small fishing net spawn location in a ruined house east of the docks.

Smithing[edit | edit source]

This town has the fifth-closest furnace to a bank, behind Port Phasmatys, Shilo Village, Edgeville and Neitiznot.

Inhabitants[edit | edit source]

  • Florin
  • Aurel
  • Cornelius
  • Gadderanks â€” the blood tithe collector, and the most hated man in Morytania. He carries the Gadderhammer, which is particularly effective against shades.
  • Elisabeta
  • Dalcian Fang (easy)
  • Fyiona Fray (easy)
  • Valantay Eppel (medium)
  • Jayene Kliyn (medium)
  • Rolayne Twickit (hard)
  • Smiddi Ryak (hard)

Quests[edit | edit source]

  • Darkness of Hallowvale
  • In Aid of the Myreque
  • A Taste of Hope

Minigames[edit | edit source]

  • The Temple Trekking minigame is available in Burgh de Rott if you have completed In Aid of the Myreque.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
24 March 2021
(update)

A misplaced tree has been moved out of the path near Burgh de Rott.

6 January 2021
(update)

A stray Tirannwn tree has been removed from Burgh de Rott and replaced with some more appropriate flora.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Most town inhabitants have a common Romanian name.

Music[edit | edit source]

  • Distant Land

'''Burgh de Rott''' is a desolate town located in the southernmost part of [[Morytania]]. It is a focal part of the [[In Aid of the Myreque]] [[quest]] and can only be accessed after you start the quest. Places of interest include the [[bank]], the [[furnace]], the [[general store]], [[fishing spots]] and the [[bar (location)|bar]]. Completion of [[Priest in Peril]] is required to access Morytania and Burgh de Rott.

==Getting there==
*Teleport using [[Morytania legs 3]] or higher
*[[Grouping teleport]] to [[Shades of Mort'ton (minigame)|Shades of Mort'ton]] (after completion of [[Shades of Mort'ton]]), or [[Mort'ton teleport]] scroll, then run south.
*[[Barrows Teleport]] (or [[Barrows teleport (tablet)]]); running through Mort'ton and then south.
*[[Fairy ring]] code {{Fairycode|bip}} (requires partial completion of [[Fairytale II - Cure a Queen]], and 50 [[Agility]] to cross the [[Stepping stone (Mort Myre Swamp)|stepping stone]] east into [[Mort Myre Swamp]]). Enter either west through the [[Low fence (Burgh de Rott)|Low Fence]] requiring 25 Agility, or going through [[Mort'ton]].
*Boat travel from [[Slepe]] or the [[Icyene Graveyard]] after the completion of [[Sins of the Father]].

==History==
Little is known about Burgh de Rott's history, but it can presumably be dated back to the time around [[Hallowvale]] in the early [[Third Age]], as [[Queen Efaritay]], the Queen of Hallowland's name, can still be found. Whether it was abandoned or destroyed during [[Lowerniel Drakan]] and his [[vampyre]]s' invasion is unknown.

In recent times the town has become a place for human refugees, who have escaped from the vampyres' tyranny. The town is in ruins and the vampyres assume it is uninhabited and thus never go there. During [[In Aid of the Myreque]] the [[player character|player]] helps fix up some of the essential parts of the town improving the living conditions for the residents. The fact that the town is populated was discovered by [[Gadderanks]] who accompanied by two [[Vampyre Juvinate]]s came to tithe the population. The player however managed to defeat Gadderanks and the vampyres meaning that Burgh de Rott is safe for now.

==Shops==
===General store===
{{Main|Aurel's Supplies}}
To access the general store you must repair it first using 6 [[plank]]s and 24 [[nails]]. After repairing it players must stock it with 10 [[bronze axe]]s, 3 [[tinderbox]]es and either 10 [[mackerel]] or 10 [[snail]]s.

==Skills==
===Fishing===
All the [[fishing spots]] in Burgh de Rott are Big net/harpoon fishing spots, making this town nearly as convenient as [[Catherby]]. There also is a [[small fishing net]] spawn location in a ruined house east of the docks.

===Smithing===
This town has the fifth-closest [[furnace]] to a [[bank]], behind [[Port Phasmatys]], [[Shilo Village (location)|Shilo Village]], [[Edgeville]] and [[Neitiznot]].

==Inhabitants==
*[[Florin]]
*[[Aurel]]
*[[Cornelius]]
*[[Gadderanks]] â€” the [[blood tithe]] collector, and the most hated man in Morytania. He carries the [[Gadderhammer]], which is particularly effective against [[Shade (disambiguation)|shade]]s.
*[[Elisabeta]]
*[[Dalcian Fang (easy)]]
*[[Fyiona Fray (easy)]]
*[[Valantay Eppel (medium)]]
*[[Jayene Kliyn (medium)]]
*[[Rolayne Twickit (hard)]]
*[[Smiddi Ryak (hard)]]

==Quests==
*[[Darkness of Hallowvale]]
*[[In Aid of the Myreque]]
*[[A Taste of Hope]]

==Minigames==
*The [[Temple Trekking]] [[minigame]] is available in Burgh de Rott if you have completed In Aid of the Myreque.
